snippet: The prosecutor of the International Criminal Court said Friday that she was suspending investigations in Darfur because no arrests had been made in a decade and the United Nations Security Council had been unwilling to use its powers to help.
abstract: Fatou Bensouda, prosecutor of the International Criminal Court, is suspending investigations in Darfur; cites limited resources, fact that no arrests have been made in decade and absence of help from United nations Security Council in decision.
lead_paragraph: The prosecutor of the International Criminal Court said Friday that she was suspending investigations in Darfur because no arrests had been made in a decade and the United Nations Security Council had been unwilling to use its powers to help.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
